definition: to occupy by force/to seize/to dominate
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

sentences.english: I felt that I owed him something.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得像是霸佔了他的東西。

sentences.english: That Guy was driving down the center of the road being a hog; he hogged the whole road.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙開車開在馬路中間象個路霸，霸佔了整條道。

sentences.english: The war is caused by a dispute over the annexe of a strip of land.
sentences.chinese: 該戰爭由對一塊狹長土地霸佔的爭議所引起。

sentences.english: Deforce , I deforce his daughter for his lots of debt.
sentences.chinese: 我霸佔了他的女兒，因爲他見我一屁股債。

sentences.english: Li Dagen is set bureau profaned small fragrant, want to continue to occupy by force again later small fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 李大根設局玷污了小芳，之後又想繼續霸佔小芳。

sentences.english: Her nightmare begun from there onwards and her step father continue raping her till today.
sentences.chinese: 從此噩夢開始了，繼父長期霸佔她至今。

sentences.english: And then the city boss appears, municipal corruption became a popular thing in American.
sentences.chinese: 於是，城市老闆霸佔市廳數十年，貪污腐敗盛行一時。

sentences.english: Make sure to use an anti-virus program that does not hog up all of your computer resources.
sentences.chinese: 確定這一個防病毒軟件不會霸佔你的電腦資源。

sentences.english: The friends commandeer the road train.
When you enter a room, learn to claim territory.
sentences.chinese: 當你走進一間屋子時，要學會霸佔領地。

sentences.english: My farm has been taken over by a rich man. His slaves are harvesting my fields.
sentences.chinese: 農場由富人霸佔，農地上有他的奴工在收割。

sentences.english: The domestically produced piece wrests away the ticket head of family branch position and the introduction piece quantity not absolutely relations.
sentences.chinese: 國產片霸佔票房頭位與引進片的數量並沒有絕對關係。

sentences.english: Nikki : sorry! Am I hogging on the suite?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我霸佔了洗手檯嗎？

sentences.english: ChinaSat gradually develops into having advantageous satellite resource network.
sentences.chinese: 中國衛通漸漸構成霸佔劣勢的衛星資源網絡。

definition: to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
one's own car (or motorbike)/vehicle for one's private use
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
